member.name: M:FactualDriver.FacetQuery.IncludeRowCount
member.summary: The response will include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters. This will increase the time required to return a response. The default behavior is to NOT include a row count

member.name: M:FactualDriver.FacetQuery.IncludeRowCount(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When true, the response will include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters. Requesting the row count will increase the time required to return a response. The default behavior is to NOT include a row count.
member.param: true if you want the results to include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters

member.name: M:FactualDriver.FacetQuery.MinCountPerFacetValue(System.Int64)
member.summary: For each facet value count, the minimum number of results it must have in order to be returned in the response. Must be zero or greater. The default is 1.
member.param: minCount for each facet value count, the minimum number of results it must have in order to be returned in the response. Must be zero or greater. The default is 1.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.FacetQuery.MaxValuesPerFacet(System.Int64)
member.summary: The maximum number of unique facet values that can be returned for a single field. Range is 1-250. The default is 25.
member.param: maxValuesPerFacet the maximum number of unique facet values that can be returned for a single field. Range is 1-250. The default is 25.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.Fetch(System.String,FactualDriver.Query)
member.summary: Runs a read query against the specified Factual table.
member.param: the name of the table you wish to query (e.g., "places")
the read query to run against table.
member.returns: the response of running query against Factual.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.Fetch(System.String,FactualDriver.ResolveQuery)
member.summary: Asks Factual to resolve the entity for the attributes specified by query, within the table called tableName. Returns the read response from a Factual Resolve request, which includes all records that are potential matches. Each result record will include a confidence score ("similarity"), and a flag indicating whether Factual decided the entity is the correct resolved match with a high degree of accuracy ("resolved"). There will be 0 or 1 entities returned with "resolved"=true. If there was a full match, it is guaranteed to be the first record in the response.
member.param: the name of the table to resolve within.
a Resolve query with partial attributes for an entity.
member.returns: the response from Factual for the Resolve request.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.Fetch(System.String,FactualDriver.FacetQuery)
member.summary: Runs a facet read against the specified Factual table.
member.param: the name of the table you wish to query for facets (e.g., "places")
the facet query to run against table
member.returns: the response of running facet against Factual.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.RawQuery(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Runs a GET request against the specified endpoint path, using the given parameters and your OAuth credentials. Returns the raw response body returned by Factual. The necessary URL base will be automatically prepended to path. If you need to change it, e.g. to make requests against a development instance of the Factual service, please set FactualApiUrlOverride property.
member.param: The endpoint path to run the request against. Example: "t/places"
The query string parameters to send with the request. Do not encode or escape these; that will be done automatically
member.returns: The response body from running the GET request against Factual

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.RawQuery(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a GET request against the specified endpoint path, using the given parameters and your OAuth credentials. Returns the raw response body returned by Factual. The necessary URL base will be automatically prepended to path. If you need to change it, e.g. to make requests against a development instance of the Factual service, please set FactualApiUrlOverride property. Developer is entirly responsible for correct query formatting and URL encoding.
member.param: The endpoint path to run the request against. Example: "t/places"
The query string parameters to send with the request
member.returns: The response body from running the GET request against Factual

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.RequestPost(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Runs a POST request against the specified endpoint path, using the given parameters and your OAuth credentials. Returns the raw response body returned by Factual. The necessary URL base will be automatically prepended to path. If you need to change it, e.g. to make requests against a development instance of the Factual service, please set FactualApiUrlOverride property.
member.param: The endpoint path to run the request against. Example: "t/places"
The query string parameters to send with the request. Do not encode or escape these; that will be done automatically
The POST content parameters to send with the request. Do not encode or escape these; that will be done automatically
member.returns: The response body from running the POST request against Factual

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Factual.RequestPost(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a POST request against the specified endpoint path, using the given parameters and your OAuth credentials. Returns the raw response body returned by Factual. The necessary URL base will be automatically prepended to path. If you need to change it, e.g. to make requests against a development instance of the Factual service, please set FactualApiUrlOverride property. Developer is entirly responsible for correct query formatting and URL encoding.
member.param: The endpoint path to run the request against. Example: "t/places"
The query string parameters to send with the request
The POST content parameters to send with the request
member.returns: The response body from running the POST request against Factual

member.name: T:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase
member.summary: The original OAuth code from http://eran.sandler.co.il/, hosted at http://oauth.net Modified only to change namespace. Written by Eran Sandler (http://eran.sandler.co.il) Edited by Claudio Cherubino and Alain Vongsouvanh Further editited by Sergey Maskalik

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.ComputeHash(System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Helper function to compute a hash value
member.param: The hashing algorithm used. If that algorithm needs some initialization, like HMAC and its derivatives, they should be initialized prior to passing it to this function
The data to hash
member.returns: a Base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GetQueryParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded version of GetQueryParameters to work without a IDictionary parameter
member.param: The query string part of the Url
member.returns: A sorted dictionary with string keys and values representing the query parameters

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GetQueryParameters(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Internal function to parse query string parameters and merge them with an existing dictionary
member.param: The query string part of the Url
The dictionary to be merged with the query string parameters
member.returns: A sorted dictionary with string keys and values representing the query parameters merged with the values taken from the dictionary passed as parameter

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.EncodingPerRFC3986(System.String)
member.summary: All parameter names and values are escaped using the [RFC3986] percent-encoding (%xx) mechanism. Characters not in the unreserved character MUST be encoded. Characters in the unreserved character set MUST NOT be encoded. Hexadecimal characters in encodings MUST be upper case. Text names and values MUST be encoded as UTF-8 octets before percent-encoding them per [RFC3629]
member.param: The value to Url encode

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.NormalizeRequestParameters(System.Collections.Generic.SortedDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Normalizes the request parameters according to the spec for the signature generation.
member.param: The sorted dictionary containing parameters
member.returns: a string representing the normalized parameters

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GenerateSignatureBase(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate the signature base that is used to produce the signature
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The OAuth timestamp. Must be a valid timestamp and equal or greater than timestamps used in previous requests
The OAuth nonce. A random string uniquely generated for each request
The signature type.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GenerateSignatureBase(System.Uri,System.String,FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthParameters)
member.summary: Generate the signature base that is used to produce the signature
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The OAuth parameters

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GenerateSignatureUsingHash(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Generate the signature value based on the given signature base and hash algorithm
member.param: The signature based as produced by the GenerateSignatureBase method or by any other means
The hash algorithm used to perform the hashing. If the hashing algorithm requires initialization or a key it should be set prior to calling this method
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GenerateSignature(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a signature using the HMAC-SHA1 algorithm
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The consumer seceret
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The OAuth timestamp. Must be a valid timestamp and equal or greater than timestamps used in previous requests
The OAuth nonce. A random string uniquely generated for each request
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:FactualDriver.OAuth.OAuthBase.GenerateSignature(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a signature using the specified signatureMethod
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The consumer seceret
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The OAuth timestamp. Must be a valid timestamp and equal or greater than timestamps used in previous requests
The OAuth nonce. A random string uniquely generated for each request
The type of signature to use
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Query.IncludeRowCount
member.summary: The response will include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters. This will increase the time required to return a response. The default behavior is to NOT include a row count.
member.returns: this Query, marked to return total row count when run.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Query.IncludeRowCount(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When true, the response will include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters. Requesting the row count will increase the time required to return a response. The default behavior is to NOT include a row count.
member.param: true if you want the results to include a count of the total number of rows in the table that conform to the request based on included filters.
member.returns: this Query, marked to return total row count when run.

member.summary: Converts ResolveQuery object into url encoded string

member.name: T:FactualDriver.RowQuery
member.summary: Represents a Factual row query. Knows how to represent the query as URL encoded key value pairs, ready for the query string in a GET request.

member.name: F:FactualDriver.RowQuery._parameters
member.summary: Holds all parameters for this query

member.name: M:FactualDriver.RowQuery.Only(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Sets the fields to select. This is optional; default behaviour is generally to select all fields in the schema.
member.param: the fields to select.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.RowQuery.Only(System.String[])
member.summary: Sets the fields to select. This is optional; default behaviour is generally to select all fields in the schema.
member.param: the fields to select.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.RowQuery.ToUrlQuery
member.summary: Converts a path object into a uri path string for communication with Factual's API. Provides proper URL encoding and escaping.
member.returns: Returns the path string to represent this RowQuery when talking to Factual's API.

member.name: T:FactualDriver.Submit
member.summary: Represents an add or update submission to a Factual row.

member.name: F:FactualDriver.Submit._parameters
member.summary: Holds all parameters for this Submit.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Submit.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Constructor for a submit with values initialized as key value pairs in mapping.
member.param: values this submit is initialized with

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Submit.AddValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set the value for a single field in this submit request. Added to a JSON hash of field names and values to be added to a Factual table.
member.param: the field name
the value for the specified field

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Submit.RemoveValue(System.String)
member.summary: Set the value to null for a single field in this submit request.
member.param: field the field to set as empty, or null.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Submit.ToUrlQuery
member.summary: Output submit values to url query

member.name: T:FactualDriver.Utils.JsonUtil
member.summary: Utility which convertes filters to json represenation.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Utils.JsonUtil.ToQueryString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{FactualDriver.Filters.IFilter})
member.summary: Converts an array of filters into a uri encoded query string which can be sent to factual api.
member.param: sequence of IFilter objects.

member.name: M:FactualDriver.Utils.JsonUtil.ToQueryString(FactualDriver.Filters.IFilter[])
member.summary: Converts an array of filters into a uri encoded query string which can be sent to factual api.
